items.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18689)
items.content_html:
Twitter @leslieherod was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `The requested resource cannot be found!
Please make sure your input parameters are correct!
cUrl error: (0)
PHP error: `
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Twitter&context=By+username&u=leslieherod&norep=on&nopic=on&noimg=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

items.title: "A Marshall Project survey of the incarcerated showed...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A Marshall Project survey of the incarcerated showed widespread interest in the coronavirus vaccine as well as pervasive distrust of the prison medical system."

The Marshall Project

A Marshall Project survey of the incarcerated showed widespread interest in the coronavirus vaccine as well as pervasive distrust of the prison medical system.

themarshallproject.org

We Asked People Behind Bars How They Feel About Getting Vaccinated

A Marshall Project survey of the incarcerated showed widespread interest in the coronavirus vaccine as well as pervasive distrust of the prison medical system.A Marshall Project survey of the incarcerated showed widespread interest in the coronavirus vaccine as well as pervasive distrust of the prison medical system.

items.title: "Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette Johnson’s fiery dissents on mass incarceration and sentencing in America’s most carceral state garnered international attention. But the rise of the first Black woman on the court was characterized by one battle after another with the Deep South’s white power structure."

The Appeal

Former Louisiana Supreme Court Chief Justice Bernette Johnson’s fiery dissents on mass incarceration and sentencing in America’s most carceral state garnered international attention. But the rise of the first Black woman on the court was characterized by one battle after another with the Deep So...

items.content_html:

items.title: "I think (the report) just shows the culture of blue...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"I think (the report) just shows the culture of blue protecting blue, but not really looking out for the best interest of the community. That’s why we need to have independent investigations, and not just in cases that go global.” - State Representative Leslie Herod

The Denver Post

The results of an external investigation into the death of Elijah McClain have prompted questions about whether the system used by Colorado law enforcement to investigate police shootings and other…

items.title: "[It] is quickly evolving. We've made bold changes ......
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"[It] is quickly evolving. We've made bold changes ... and people are using this momentum that was created this past year to make change not only through the political process, but also in their own places of work, their homes, their schools and our community." - State House Representative Leslie Herod

Former Mayor Wellington Webb is "inspired by the coalition of young people and races that have come together to fight."

axios.com

"We have a lot of work to do": Key leaders reflect on the state of Denver's Black community

Former Mayor Wellington Webb is "inspired by the coalition of young people and races that have come together to fight."Former Mayor Wellington Webb is "inspired by the coalition of young people and races that have come together to fight."

items.title: "A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday."

The Colorado Sun

A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday. Colorado funds its schools on a per-pupil basis, and lawmakers could have held back millions promised to schools after the October student tally recorded ne...

coloradosun.com

Colorado lawmakers advance effort to maintain school funding despite enrollment declines

A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday. Colorado funds its schools on a per-pupil basis, and lawmakers could have held back millions promised to schools after the October student tally recorded ne...A bill that holds funding steady for Colorado schools despite a pandemic-related drop in enrollment passed the state Senate unanimously Friday. Colorado funds its schools on a per-pupil basis, and lawmakers could have held back millions promised to schools after the October student tally recorded ne...

items.title: "A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase 1B.4, is scheduled to start around March 21 and people 50 or older will be among the vaccinated, according to the state. The new phase, announced Friday by Gov. Jared Polis, is expected to vaccinate about 2.5 million Coloradans."

The Denver Post

A new timeline and grouping for COVID-19 vaccines, Phase 1B.4, is scheduled to start around March 21 and people 50 or older will be among the vaccinated, according to the state.

denverpost.com

COVID-19 vaccine in Colorado: Who is eligible in phase 1B.4 starting around March 21?

items.title: “DENVER (CBS4)– As CBS4 celebrates Black History Month, CBS4...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“DENVER (CBS4)– As CBS4 celebrates Black History Month, CBS4 Political Specialist Shaun Boyd talked to a state representative who is making history. Rep. Leslie Herod took the state Legislature by storm when was she was elected four years ago.”

As CBS4 celebrates Black History Month, CBS4 Political Specialist Shaun Boyd talked to a state representative who is making history. Rep. Leslie Herod took the state Legislature by storm when was she was elected four years ago.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Rep. Leslie Herod Is A Force Of Nature At The State Capitol

As CBS4 celebrates Black History Month, CBS4 Political Specialist Shaun Boyd talked to a state representative who is making history. Rep. Leslie Herod took the state Legislature by storm when was she was elected four years ago.As CBS4 celebrates Black History Month, CBS4 Political Specialist Shaun Boyd talked to a state representative who is making history. Rep. Leslie Herod took the state Legislature by storm when was she was elected four years ago.

items.title: "Aurora police followed departmental protocol after Elijah...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Aurora police followed departmental protocol after Elijah McClain died in their custody in August 2019. The chief promised transparency and called in the team of Denver and Aurora detectives normally used to investigate police shootings. The detectives conducted an investigation and turned it over to the district attorney."

The Denver Post

The results of an external investigation into the death of Elijah McClain have prompted questions about whether the system used by Colorado law enforcement to investigate police shootings and other…

denverpost.com

items.title: "The Army, which is increasingly dependent on female...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The Army, which is increasingly dependent on female soldiers, has issued new regulations that allow women to wear lipstick and no longer limits their hair to a tight, disciplined bun."

The New York Times

The Army, which is increasingly dependent on female soldiers, has issued new regulations that allow women to wear lipstick and no longer limits their hair to a tight, disciplined bun.

nytimes.com

In a Changing Military, the Army Eases Its Rules for Women’s Hair

items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Congress wants to make it easier for state and local governments to defund the police by instead funding mental health services and empowering them to respond to emergency calls instead of armed officers."

The Hill

What is the Mental Health Justice Act?

thehill.com

New bill funds mental health experts, not police, to respond to emergencies: 'mental illness is not a crime'

items.title: "Jackson, the first African American female engineer at...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Jackson, the first African American female engineer at NASA, began her career with the agency in the segregated West Area Computing Unit of NASA’s Langley Research Center in Hampton, Virginia. The mathematician and aerospace engineer went on to lead programs influencing the hiring and promotion of women in NASA's science, technology, engineering, and mathematics careers."

NASA - National Aeronautics and Space Administration

Acting NASA Administrator Steve Jurczyk will lead a ceremony at 1 p.m. EST Friday, Feb. 26, officially naming the NASA Headquarters building in Washington in honor of Mary W. Jackson

nasa.gov

NASA to Honor ‘Hidden Figure’ Mary W. Jackson During Naming Ceremony

Acting NASA Administrator Steve Jurczyk will lead a ceremony at 1 p.m. EST Friday, Feb. 26, officially naming the NASA Headquarters building in Washington in honor of Mary W. JacksonActing NASA Administrator Steve Jurczyk will lead a ceremony at 1 p.m. EST Friday, Feb. 26, officially naming the NASA Headquarters building in Washington in honor of Mary W. Jackson

"Denver City Council declared Juneteenth an official commemorative holiday in the city on Monday, and approved a bill that will lead to a National Weather Service observation station at the old Stapleton International Airport site."

The Denver Post

Denver City Council declared Juneteenth an official commemorative holiday in the city on Monday night, and approved a bill that will set up a National Weather Service observation station at the old…

items.title: "A letter sent Monday by Ian Rosenblum, acting assistant...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"A letter sent Monday by Ian Rosenblum, acting assistant education secretary, calls for states to give standardized tests this year, despite pandemic disruptions. Rosenblum writes that the U.S. Department of Education will provide flexibility but not 'blanket waivers' of federal testing requirements."

The Colorado Sun

The sponsor of a bill seeking to suspend Colorado’s standardized tests this year believes the state can use other tests most students already take and still adhere to federal testing rules. A letter sent Monday by Ian Rosenblum, acting assistant education secretary, calls for states to give standa...

coloradosun.com

Colorado lawmaker pushing ahead with effort to suspend state testing despite federal requirement

The sponsor of a bill seeking to suspend Colorado’s standardized tests this year believes the state can use other tests most students already take and still adhere to federal testing rules. A letter sent Monday by Ian Rosenblum, acting assistant education secretary, calls for states to give standa...The sponsor of a bill seeking to suspend Colorado’s standardized tests this year believes the state can use other tests most students already take and still adhere to federal testing rules. items.title: "In a ruling issued earlier this month, a federal court...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In a ruling issued earlier this month, a federal court left a Black man on death row despite the emergence of new documents that suggest prosecutors sought to eliminate Black people from the jury pool. The decision reveals the length to which judges will go to permit prosecutors’ maneuvers, and underscores the urgency of political solutions that could create meaningful constraints on prosecutors."

The Appeal

The Fifth Circuit’s decision against James Garfield Broadnax, a Black man on death row in Texas, is the latest example of the deference judges grant prosecutors to craft white juries.

theappeal.org

Prosecutors Excluded Black Jurors in a Death Penalty Case. They’re Getting Away With It.

The Fifth Circuit’s decision against James Garfield Broadnax, a Black man on death row in Texas, is the latest example of the deference judges grant prosecutors to craft white juries.The Fifth Circuit’s decision against James Garfield Broadnax, a Black man on death row in Texas, is the latest example of the deference judges grant prosecutors to craft white juries.

items.title: “'They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

“'They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags,' said Officer Harry Dunn. 'They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol.'”

HuffPost

“They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags," said Officer Harry Dunn. "They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol."

huffpost.com

Police Officer Who Battled Capitol Mob Slams Racist Abuse From Rioters: 'Is This America?'

“They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags," said Officer Harry Dunn. "They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol."“They beat police officers with Blue Lives Matter flags," said Officer Harry Dunn. "They fought us. They had Confederate flags in the U.S. Capitol."

items.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
items.content_html:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine

...

📸 Paul Miller Photography
Hair: Dornise LaTone Afhair
Styling: LILFRESHSAM

See MoreForget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.

5280.com

State Representative Leslie Herod Has a Story to Share | 5280

Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system.
